title: Naga ritualist
data:

*For a list of all nagas, see [list of nagas](/List_of_nagas "List of nagas").*

| Attack2                                                                                             | 4 ([constrict](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [crush](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))                                                                                         |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An esoteric mystic draped in talismans. Their sect venerate poison as a sacred gift and means of spiritual purification, and their affinity for it is even stronger than the rest of their kin. By invoking secret rites they can render any venom more potent and spread its touch upon all those around them. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Naga ritualists** are spellcasters who try to stack [poison](/Poison "Poison") on their foes. Travelling with a pack of [black mambas](/Black_mamba "Black mamba"), [anacondas](/Anaconda "Anaconda"), and [mana vipers](/Mana_viper "Mana viper"), they are always armed with weapons of [venom](/Venom "Venom"), regularly blast you with [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance"), and can rapidly magnify your poison level even further while stripping you of your poison resistance through [Virulence](/Virulence "Virulence").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                                                 |                                                                                                           |
| :---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Spit Poison](/Spit_Poison "Spit Poison") (d13)                                 | [Natural flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), [Breath flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Olgreb's Toxic Radiance](/Olgreb%27s_Toxic_Radiance "Olgreb's Toxic Radiance") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                       |
| Slot3       | [Virulence](/Virulence "Virulence")                                             | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags")                                                       |

## Tips & Tricks

- The beds of snakes naga ritualists travel with would normally not be too threatening, but that can change quickly if you wind up with your poison resistance removed. Take advantage of the fact that a ritualist's snakes move much faster than it does and separate them to make the fight much easier.
- High [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") will allow you to shrug off Virulence easily enough, but this isn't a necessity unless you're fighting several foes at once. A lone ritualist shouldn't put up too much of a fight, though you may need to rest after the battle until the toxins leave your system.
- Remember that a single [potion of curing](/Potion_of_curing "Potion of curing") will remove all poison from your system, no matter how massive the dose.

## History

- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), naga ritualists could cast [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance").
- Naga ritualists were added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14").
html:
Naga ritualist

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.27: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

For a list of all nagas, see list of nagas.

naga ritualist N 
HP 39-80
HD 8
XP 687
Speed 10 (move: 140%)
AC 8
EV 10
Will 60
Attack1 14 (hit: plain)
Attack2 4 (constrict: crush)


Resistances rPois+
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type naga, naga
Flags See invisible
Speaks
Warm-blooded
An esoteric mystic draped in talismans. Their sect venerate poison as a sacred gift and means of spiritual purification, and their affinity for it is even stronger than the rest of their kin. By invoking secret rites they can render any venom more potent and spread its touch upon all those around them.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Naga ritualists are spellcasters who try to stack poison on their foes. Travelling with a pack of black mambas, anacondas, and mana vipers, they are always armed with weapons of venom, regularly blast you with Olgreb's Toxic Radiance, and can rapidly magnify your poison level even further while stripping you of your poison resistance through Virulence.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Spit Poison (d13) Natural flag,
Breath flag
Slot2 Olgreb's Toxic Radiance Wizard flag
Slot3 Virulence Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • The beds of snakes naga ritualists travel with would normally not be too threatening, but that can change quickly if you wind up with your poison resistance removed. Take advantage of the fact that a ritualist's snakes move much faster than it does and separate them to make the fight much easier.
  • High willpower will allow you to shrug off Virulence easily enough, but this isn't a necessity unless you're fighting several foes at once. A lone ritualist shouldn't put up too much of a fight, though you may need to rest after the battle until the toxins leave your system.
  • Remember that a single potion of curing will remove all poison from your system, no matter how massive the dose.

History

  • Prior to 0.27, naga ritualists could cast Force Lance.
  • Naga ritualists were added in 0.14.

{{version027}}
{{list of | nagas}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Naga ritualists''' are spellcasters who try to stack [[poison]] on their foes. Travelling with a pack of [[black mamba]]s, [[anaconda]]s, and [[mana viper]]s, they are always armed with weapons of [[venom]], regularly blast you with [[Olgreb's Toxic Radiance]], and can rapidly magnify your poison level even further while stripping you of your poison resistance through [[Virulence]].

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*The beds of snakes naga ritualists travel with would normally not be too threatening, but that can change quickly if you wind up with your poison resistance removed. Take advantage of the fact that a ritualist's snakes move much faster than it does and separate them to make the fight much easier.
*High [[willpower]] will allow you to shrug off Virulence easily enough, but this isn't a necessity unless you're fighting several foes at once. A lone ritualist shouldn't put up too much of a fight, though you may need to rest after the battle until the toxins leave your system.
*Remember that a single [[potion of curing]] will remove all poison from your system, no matter how massive the dose.

==History==
* Prior to [[0.27]], naga ritualists could cast [[Force Lance]].
* Naga ritualists were added in [[0.14]].

[[Category:Naga]]
